learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and - Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and analysis of recent disciplinary developments in scholarship and professional practice in the teaching of Economics. APST 2.1

Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and - Demonstrate the ability to apply knowledge of how students learn and knowledge of relevant curriculum documents to the development of appropriate discipline based learning goals and teaching strategies for students of varying abilities.  APST 1.2, 1.5, 2.1, 3.1

Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and - Demonstrate the ability to design, implement and evaluate learning and teaching sequences and discipline specific assessment tasks that draw on relevant curriculum documents, a range of effective teaching resources, a range of assessment and reporting strategies, and ICT knowledge that enables teaching strategies that expands learning.APST 2.2, 2.3, 2.6, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 5.1
Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and - Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of literacy and numeracy teaching strategies and their application in Economics.  APST 2.5

Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and - Demonstrate the ability to respond to feedback, and identify and design discipline specific opportunities for professional learning engagement and communication within the school context, teaching networks and the broader community and understand the rationale for this professional practice in relation to improved student learning.  APST 6.3, 6.4, 7.4
Demonstrate understanding of relevant content and - Demonstrate clear, fluent and coherent communication skills in English consistent with personal, professional and academic conventions. APST 2.1

assessments.due_date:
Microteaching Presentation 26/03/2026 - 2/04/2026

Reflection 2/04/2026 - 16/04/2026

Presentation Times: In class 16:00 to 18:50

Reflection: 1 week after presentation
assessments.task_description:
Context

Using the Queensland Economics Syllabus you are to present an interactive teaching activity. This presentation will occur during Semester One. We will dedicate time in our tutorials to microteaching. Each student will present a microteaching segment of 15 minutes that will be graded.

The Task

You are to select from the lesson topics provided one week in advance from the Economics Syllabus and complete the following:

Prior to class

  • Prepare a 60-minute lesson plan to teach an agreed economic concept
  • Prepare to teach a 10-minute interactive active learning component within your lesson plan as your microteaching segment
  • Prepare any resources you are going to use during your 10 minute presentation

Note: You need to ensure that if you are using any audio-visual clips, they do not exceed more than 2 minutes of your 10 minute allocated timeslot

During class

  • Hand in a hard copy of your lesson plan and a copy of the resources you will use for your microteaching segment.
  • Outline where your activity fits into your lesson using your lesson plan in five minutes. You should refer to past knowledge the students have and other activities that will occur in the lesson in this outline.
  • Conduct your 10 minute interactive learning activity.


Due to be drop boxed on Blackboard within one week of your presentation

  • Complete a personal reflection on both your lesson and lesson plan outlining:
  • What went well?
  • What you could improve for next time?
  • What professional learning you need to complete to improve student learning?
  • A rationale outlining the importance of continued professional learning.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Day of presentation: Hand in a hard copy of your lesson plan and a copy of the resources you will use for your microteaching segment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Context

After completing your micro teaching task in Semester One and throughout your professional experience placement, you will have reflected on your own personal professional goals in Economics Curriculum Studies to improve your teaching and student outcomes. Throughout Semester Two, we will dedicate time in our tutorials to sharing strategies to address professional development needs in a community context. During this time, each student will facilitate a session of 15 minutes that will be graded.

The Task

You are to individually select a personal professional goal based on feedback you have received to date:

Prior to class

  • Conduct research into how students learn and the implications for teaching which will help you achieve growth towards your personal professional goal.
  • Prepare and submit to TurnItIn a 1500-word report that outlines:
  • Your personal professional goal and an overview of why continued professional learning is essential for teachers including:
  • Background explaining why you identified this goal and how it is linked to feedback you have received from supervisors and teachers;
  • Academic research on strategies to use;
  • Classroom interventions and practical tips;
  • Expected impact on teaching and learning;
  • An overview of how you plan to work with professional associations and community representatives to build your professional knowledge and contribute to enhance teaching practices.
  • Upload an abstract of your presentation to the discussion board on Blackboard (250 words).


During class

  • Facilitate a 15-minute session to share what you have learned with your class.


After class

  • Respond to at least two students’ submissions suggesting an alternative approach for using these strategies in your own teaching to improve student outcomes.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your 1,500 word report to Turnitin on Blackboard and your abstract on the Discussion Board
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Context

To ensure that the learning intents of the syllabus are delivered effectively, teachers need to plan their learning sequences and ensure that assessment tasks meet the requirements of the instrument specific marking guides.

The Task

You are to individually create a 20-25 lesson unit of work based on the 2025 Queensland Economics Syllabus. You are not permitted to use Unit 1 for this assignment.

Your submission needs to include the following:

1. Provide a unit overview in a detailed grid format (use detailed grid template on Blackboard) which outlines:

  • Learning goal/intent
  • Key content/vocab/terminology
  • Key teaching, reporting and learning strategies
  • Demonstrate planning and sequencing content and tasks to become increasingly challenging
  • Incorporate spacing and retrieval practice (CC 2.1 – assessed)
  • Show skill in explicit teaching, modelling and scaffolding practices that support how a student’s brain learns (CC 2.2 – assessed)
  • Literacy and numeracy activities
  • Marzano cognition
  • Resources required
  • Homework
  • Assessment strategies (e.g. informal, formal, diagnostic, formative, summative)


2. Describe and justify the teaching strategies/approaches to be used (with academic references). In this section you are to refer to relevant learning theory.

3. Prepare detailed lesson plans for three key lessons within your unit plan and provide all resources digitally (if you are using physical resources, take a photo and include it with your submission).

4. You need to ensure that at least one of these three lessons demonstrates the implementation of ICT teaching strategies. Justify how these strategies expand curriculum learning opportunities for students.

5. Using one lesson, explain how you have set learning goals that provide achievable challenges for students of varying abilities and characteristics.

6 Explain how in your unit (and detailed lesson plans) you have incorporated strategies to differentiate teaching to meet the specific learning needs of students across the full range of abilities. In addition, demonstrate knowledge of and skill in planning and sequencing content and tasks so that they become increasingly challenging and incorporate spacing and retrieval practice, and demonstrate knowledge of and skill in explicit teaching, modelling and scaffolding practices that support how a student’s brain learns.

7. Explain how in your unit (and detailed lesson plans) you have incorporated strategies to differentiate teaching to meet the specific learning needs of students across the full range of abilities.

8. Explain how literacy and numeracy strategies will be incorporated and developed within your unit. You need to provide specific examples of activities or strategies used.

9. Provide an assessment task and criteria for the unit that reflects the requirements of the curriculum document. Demonstrate your understanding of assessment strategies by describing how you will use a range of approaches throughout the unit (e.g. informal, formal, diagnostic, formative, summative) to assess student learning.

Word Count: 1500-2000 which does not include:

  • Item 1 - Unit plan grid overview
  • Item 3 - 3 x lesson plans with associated resources
  • Item 8 - Assessment Task
assessments.submission_guidelines: Dropbox Assessment Task 3 in one file to Turnitin on Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic: Spare Week
learning_activities.topic_description: Spare Week

learning_activities.topic:
Session 1 - Introduction to teaching Economics

Workshop 1: Introduction to Teaching Economics. Introducing the QCAA Economics syllabus document (Years 11-12) focusing on the key elements of curriculum, assessment and reporting. We will also explore the QCAA Economics Subject Report. Activities include unpacking perceptions of teaching and learning, distinguishing the skills taught in Economics compared to other subjects and understanding how students learn. Students will also be introduced to professional engagement as an Economics teacher.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 1 - Introduction to teaching Economics Workshop 1: Introduction to Teaching Economics. Introducing the QCAA Economics syllabus document (Years 11-12) focusing on the key elements of curriculum, assessment and reporting.  We will also explore the QCAA Economics Subject Report. Activities include unpacking perceptions of teaching and learning, distinguishing the skills taught in Economics compared to other subjects and understanding how students learn.  Students will also be introduced to professional engagement as an Economics teacher.

learning_activities.topic:
Session 2 - Microteaching and Lesson Planning

Workshop 2: Microteaching and Lesson Planning. Students will teach a topic of their choice in a 10 minute segment in a supportive environment. This microteaching demonstration will be focused on active learning where the teacher is "facilitating" and the students are "doing". Individual feedback will be provided to each student. Activities include engaging in a class discussion to identify effective strategies that increase engagement and student learning, exploring articles on active learning and introducing a lesson planning template. Students will also experience teaching and learning with ICT.


Learning outcomes: L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 2 - Microteaching and Lesson Planning Workshop 2:  Microteaching and Lesson Planning. Students will teach a topic of their choice in a 10 minute segment in a supportive environment.  This microteaching demonstration will be focused on active learning where the teacher is "facilitating" and the students are "doing".  Individual feedback will be provided to each student.  Activities include engaging in a class discussion to identify effective strategies that increase engagement and student learning, exploring articles on active learning and introducing a lesson planning template.  Students will also experience teaching and learning with ICT.

learning_activities.topic:
Session 3 - Microteaching and Unit Planning

Workshop 3: Microteaching and Unit Planning. Students will present a practice run of their micro-teaching including a full lesson plan, identification of their 10 minute active learning segment & reflection. Students will receive feedback from both the Course Coordinator and their peers. Students will start to understand how the syllabus links to unit plans, lesson plans and active learning activities.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 3 - Microteaching and Unit Planning Workshop 3:  Microteaching and Unit Planning . Students will present a practice run of their micro-teaching including a full lesson plan, identification of their 10 minute active learning segment & reflection. Students will receive feedback from both the Course Coordinator and their peers.  Students will start to understand how the syllabus links to unit plans, lesson plans and active learning activities.

Students will receive feedback from both the Course Coordinator and their peers. Students will work in groups to develop clear instructions for scenarios.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Session 7 - Behaviour Management

Workshop 7: Behaviour Management. Students will engage in individual and collaborative scenario activities to explore different approaches to behaviour management.  Activities include engaging in a class discussion to identify effective strategies that reduce behaviour management incidents, exploring articles on behaviour management and introducing different frameworks.


Learning outcomes: L02, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Session 9 - Cognitive Verbs of Analyse and Evaluate

Workshop 9: Cognitive Verbs of Analyse and Evaluate. Students will complete activities individually and collaboratively to distinguish between the cognitive verbs of analyse and evaluate. Activities including unpacking the syllabus descriptors for each cognition, exploring different teaching strategies and designing activities for the classroom.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06

Workshop 10: Literacy and Numeracy. Students will complete activities individually and collaboratively to understand how literacy and numeracy activities can be incorporated in the economics classroom. Activities including unpacking the syllabus requirements, exploring different teaching strategies and designing activities for the classroom.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Session 13 - Assessment Design & Development - Part 1

Workshop 13: Assessment Design & Development – Part 1. Students will engage with assessment design and development including diagnostic, formative and summative approaches to assess student learning and check for understanding. Activities will focus on syllabus requirements and QCAA exemplars.

Learning outcomes: L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 13 - Assessment Design & Development - Part 1 Workshop 13: Assessment Design & Development – Part 1. Students will engage with a ssessment design and development including diagnostic, formative and summative approaches to assess student learning and check for understanding. Activities will focus on syllabus requirements and QCAA exemplars.

learning_activities.topic:
Session 14 - Assessment Design & Development - Part 2

Workshop 14: Assessment Design & Development – Part 2. Students will continue work from last week. Students will complete activities individually and collaboratively to write questions that address the cognitions of Comprehending, Analysing and Evaluating. Students will begin to design their own assessment task for their Unit Plan and receive peer feedback.

Learning outcomes: L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Session 14 - Assessment Design & Development - Part 2 Workshop 14: Assessment Design & Development – Part 2. Students will continue work from last week. Students will complete activities individually and collaboratively to write questions that address the cognitions of Comprehending, Analysing and Evaluating. Students will begin to design their own assessment task for their Unit Plan and receive peer feedback.

learning_activities.topic:
Session 15 - Teaching strategies using ICT, creating inclusive classrooms & Professional Associations

Workshop 15: Teaching strategies using ICT, creating inclusive classrooms & Professional Associations. Students will explore strategies for using ICT in the economics classroom and creating an inclusive and supportive environment to cater for all students in an Economics classroom (principles of UDL). Students will explore professional learning opportunities and professional engagement as an Economics teacher.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05, L06

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L06
